raijin.pathutils

Various functions for dealing with path based manipulation and retrieval.

Author:
Paul Crane

@safe string isInPath(const string executableName);
Determines if executableName is in the user's path.

Params:
string executableName Name of the executable to look for.

Returns:
The path to the executable if found otherwise null.

@trusted bool ensurePathExists(const string path);
Ensures a directory path exists by creating it if it does not already exist.

Params:
string path string containing the path to create.

Returns:
true if path was created false otherwise.

@trusted bool ensurePathExists(T...)(T args);
Ensures a directory path exists by creating it if it does not already exist.

Params:
T args Variable number of argument strings containing the path to create.

Returns:
true if path was created false otherwise.

@trusted bool removePathIfExists(const string path);
Remove the path if it exists.

Params:
string path path to create.

pure nothrow @safe bool removePathIfExists(T...)(T args);
Remove the path if it exists.

Params:
T args Variable number of strings that compose the path.

@safe string getAppPath();
Retrieves the complete path where the application resides.

@safe string getAppPath(string[] path...);
Retrieves the complete path where the application resides with the provided path appended.

Params:
string[] path The path to append to the application path.

Examples:
immutable string notFound =  isInPath("fakeprogram");
immutable string found =  isInPath("ls");

assert(found.length);
assert(notFound == null);
assert(ensurePathExists("my", "test", "dir"));
assert(removePathIfExists("my"));
assert(ensurePathExists("my/test/dir"));
assert(removePathIfExists("my"));
